column4: is there a way to set mouse buttons to move back, up and forward in nautilus?
bind your keys using xbindkeys or imwheel

xbindkeys works for firefox and i have imwheel setup and configured using the button assignment i found through xev but it made no change in nautilus i used this site as a guide http://ubuntu-tutorials.com/2006/12/02/imwheel-5-button-mouse-within-nautilus-ubuntu-610/
the keyboard shortcuts for nautilus are the same for firefox and nautilus to go back and forward, so if it works in one, it has to work in the other
it really doesn't make sense to use both xbindkeys and imwheel afaics
at least not for binding the same key

that is what i thought but i could not think of anything else.  i know the shortcuts for firefox and nautilus are the same but trust me for some reason i have it working in firefox but not in nautilus
ps -ef | egrep 'imwheel|xbindkey'
i get "1000     30696  30534     0  20:07 pts/0     00:00:00 egrep imwheel|xbindkey
so neither imwheel nor xbindkeys is running?
is that what is going on?  now that i look it seems that i am actually setting up firefox mouse button functionality through Xmodmap
I doubt you need to use xmodmap
i do NEED that for my Logitech G15 keyboard
aren't we talking about your mouse?
i guess i could get rid of pointer line and then have xbindkeys run for the mouse
what is your pointer line doing?\
"pointer = 1 2 3 4 5 8 9 6 7"  i remember now that I used this line for the back and forward to work with my tilt action on the wheel and it works like a charm.... but not for nautilus
did you make sure you still need it after upgrading to 8.10?
yes in fact i had to change it for 8.10... my mouse will work without it but not the tilt function and after a long time searching i found that as a resolution
k, then just setup xbindkeys or imwheel now
so i should remove the pointer line in the xmodmap?
nah, you can leave that
